title: 114_s1286
content: The Act titled "Veterans Appeals Assistance and Improvement Act of 2015" establishes a program to provide financial assistance for legal aid to veterans seeking review by the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims. The Veterans Appeals Assistance and Improvement Act of 2015 establishes a program to provide financial assistance for legal aid to veterans seeking review by the United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims. This program facilitates the provision of legal and other assistance, without charge, to veterans and other individuals who cannot afford legal representation for decisions or proceedings in the Court. The program described in subsection (b) provides case screening, training, and pro bono representation for individuals in need. The United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims will collaborate with the Legal Services Corporation to administer financial assistance for legal aid through grants or contracts. The Legal Services Corporation will receive reimbursable payments from the Court to provide financial assistance for legal aid. No funds can be used for attorney's fees, and $3,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2018. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. Program of financial assistance for legal aid to veterans seeking review by United States Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims. Authorized $3,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2018. The Secretary will establish a program to provide financial assistance for legal and other assistance to veterans seeking review by the Board of Veterans' Appeals. This assistance will be provided through programs that offer free legal representation to veterans who cannot afford it. The Board of Veterans' Appeals provides programs for case screening, training, and pro bono representation through an agreement with the Legal Services Corporation for financial assistance. The Legal Services Corporation receives reimbursable payments from the Secretary to provide financial assistance, with a limitation on using funds for attorney's fees. $3,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year 2015 through 2018. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 59. Program of financial assistance for legal aid to veterans seeking review by Board of Veterans' Appeals. Expedited treatment of unreasonably delayed claims. Section 7112 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to provide expedited treatment for remanded or unreasonably delayed claims before the Board of Veterans Appeals. Claims pending for eight years or more are presumed to have experienced unreasonable delay. SEC. 5. Comptroller General of the United States review of appeals of decisions of Secretary of Veterans Affairs regarding claims for disability compensation. The Comptroller General of the United States will review the processing of appeals of decisions by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs on compensation claims under title 38. The review will assess various offices and examine delays in processing appeals to ensure statutory requirements for timeliness are met. The Comptroller General will review appeals of decisions by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs on compensation claims under title 38 to ensure timeliness and make recommendations for improving the processing of appeals.
